item.title: episode 2: cannot see water surface/directx 81 trouble
item.dc:creator: Mangled
item.description:
I believe the problem lies with rendering water reflections, which is expensive. When you are underwater, reflections on the surface aren’t drawn.

Episode’s 2 Engine is extensively modified from that of HL2 and Episode 1 and requires a better system to run. It’s commonly referred to as the Orange Box engine (the real name for it is the Source 2007 engine). Garry’s Mod uses this engine too.

I don’t think there is any real solution to fix it using the card you’ve got. Just use whatever settings work best I suppose.

I am using a Compaq Presario SR5350… I have actually played through episode 2 a few times on it. I just do not understand why it crashes at a lighter Directx/why I can only see the pretty water when I am in it looking out. item.title: episode 2: cannot see water surface/directx 81 trouble
item.dc:creator: Mangled
item.description:
I think you’ll find the reason for it is because… It’s not a supported GPU.

I’m presuming you are using a laptop, and that’s why you have an Intel 945 which is an integrated GPU that’s built into your motherboard.

It’s not meant for gaming… and I expect that’s the problem. It doesn’t have its own memory, so we’re talking about quite limited capabilities, so it’s no wonder why you’re having problems.
